intro: Polycarpaea breviflora var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender-flowered polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in terminal clusters and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers shaded, moist environments.
